p.k: Defensive lines built by the Nazis across Italy, which delayed the advance of Allied forces by almost two years
National Geographic explorer Albert Lin uses his hi-tech 3D scans to uncover the truth behind the legends of El Dorado, Petra and Machu Picchu
Archaeologists search an underground labyrinth for the resting place of Egypt's most mysterious Queen, Nefertiti, and discover a coffin that dates back to her reign
Metaphorically speaking, experts 'pull the plug' on the River Nile, looking at historical discoveries found at its bottom. The programme addresses issues
A plane crashes just short of the runway in San Andres. While bad weather is thought to be the cause, investigators uncover something more troubling
The investigation into the crash of a plane that nosedived into a remote desert in Patagonia. A microscopic filament provides the first tangible
Stormy seas are on the horizon, and the crews face a tough choice between heading for the safety of port and braving the elements to bring home a big catch

Tim and Fuzz head to Norfolk where a once sporty French hot hatch awaits. The car belongs to 21-year-old student Senna who comes from a family of petrol heads
74% Discovering how New York's R-160 subway car is made. Built to handle 1.6 billion riders per year, it weighs 39 tonnes and contains 24 miles of wiring
Matt Carlson tackles a new project with his sawmill as winter nears its end, and Sam Carlson helps to remedy an issue that impacts everyone's safety
World's Biggest Casino . The construction of a ?2.4billion casino in Macau, China, which includes a 3,000-suite hotel, an indoor canal, 350 shops
82% The story behind the sinking of the HMS Coventry during the Falklands War, when on May 25, 1982, Argentinian jets attacked the vessel causing it to capsize within 20 minutes

p.n: Mars: One Day on the Red Planet
p.k: Documentary capturing a single day on the surface of Mars from dawn to dusk, exploring giant volcanoes, ancient lakes, landscapes of ice, and spacecraft crash sites
Since the launch of the Hubble Space Telescope in 1990, it has captured thousands of stunning images of space and revolutionised the way the universe is understood
The case of a plane that flew into a massive storm over Indonesia during the country's rainy season, but made a seemingly impossible emergency landing
The story of the Second World War, featuring haunting images of Jewish persecution and footage of Hitler taken by his partner Eva Braun at his Alpine retreat
The use of the Olympics in advancing North Korea's political ambitions, examining Kim Jong-un's decision to send a delegation to the winter games in Pyeongchang

The trafficking of cocaine from Peru to Europe via Ghana and Nigeria, where the unguarded borders between West African countries make smuggling much easier
